content.1: And Abraham journeyed from thence toward the south country, and dwelled between Kadesh and Shur, and sojourned in Gerar.
content.2: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, She
content.3: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night, and said to him, Behold, thou
content.4: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, Lord, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?
content.5: Said he not unto me, She
content.6: And God said unto him in a dream, Yea, I know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart; for I also withheld thee from sinning against me: therefore suffered I thee not to touch her.
content.8: Therefore Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his servants, and told all these things in their ears: and the men were sore afraid.
content.9: Then Abimelech called Abraham, and said unto him, What hast thou done unto us? and what have I offended thee, that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done.
content.10: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What sawest thou, that thou hast done this thing?
content.11: And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God
content.13: And it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my father’s house, that I said unto her, This
content.14: And Abimelech took sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and womenservants, and gave
content.15: And Abimelech said, Behold, my land
content.16: And unto Sarah he said, Behold, I have given thy brother a thousand
content.17: So Abraham prayed unto God: and God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his maidservants; and they bare
